# CMFormatDescription

**Class**

An object that describes a media format descriptor.

## Declaration

```swift
class CMFormatDescription
```

## Overview

A `CMFormatDescription` object is an object that describes media types (audio, video, muxed, and so on).

## Inspecting Format Descriptions

- **audioFormatList**: The audio format list items that describe the audio formats.
- **audioStreamBasicDescription**: The audio stream description.
- **audioChannelLayout**: The audio channel layout.
- **dimensions**: The encoded pixels not including the pixel aspect ratio or clean aperture tags.
- **extensions**: A dictionary that contains all of the extensions.
- **frameDuration**: The duration of each frame.
- **frameQuanta**: The frames per second for the time code, or the frame per tick for counter mode.
- **identifiers**: An array of metadata identifiers.
- **magicCookie**: A copy of the magic cookie, if any.
- **mediaSubType**: The media subtype.
- **mediaType**: The media type.
- **mostCompatibleFormat**: The most compatible audio format list item.
- **nalUnitHeaderLength**: The size, in bytes, of the unit length field in an AVC or HEVC video sample or parameter set sample.
- **parameterSets**: The parameter sets that an H.264 or HEVC format contains.
- **richestDecodableFormat**: The audio format list item the system validates.
- **timeCodeFlags**: The flags for the available time codes.
- **tagCollections**: The tag collections associated with this media.
- **matchesTaggedBufferGroup(_:)**: Whether the format description matches a set of tagged buffers.

## Working with Audio Descriptions

- **withMagicCookie(_:)**: Returns the magic cookie.

## Working with Video Descriptions

- **cleanAperture(originIsAtTopLeft:)**: Returns the clean aperture.
- **matchesImageBuffer(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the format description matches an image buffer.
- **presentationDimensions(usePixelAspectRatio:useCleanAperture:)**: Returns the dimensions to take the pixel aspect ratio or clean aperture into account.

## Working with Metadata Descriptions

- **keyWithLocalID(_:)**: Returns the metadata for the local identifier you specify.

## Working with Text Descriptions

- **defaultStyle()**: Returns the default text style.
- **defaultTextBox(originIsAtTopLeft:heightOfTextTrack:)**: Returns the default text box.
- **displayFlags()**: Returns the display mode flags for the text media.
- **fontName(localFontID:)**: Returns the font name for the local font identifier.
- **justification()**: Returns the horizontal and vertical justification.

## Comparing Format Descriptions

- **==(_:_:)**: Equality is derived from
- **equalTo(_:equalityMask:)**: Evaluates equality for the parts of two audio format descriptions.
- **equalTo(_:extensionKeysToIgnore:sampleDescriptionExtensionAtomKeysToIgnore:)**: Evaluates equality for the parts of two audio format descriptions, ignoring the extensions you specify.

## Errors

- **CMFormatDescription.Error**: A type that describes format description errors.

## Constants

- **extensionKeysCommonWithImageBuffers**: A constant that represents keys you use with video format description extensions and image buffers.
- **typeID**: A type identifier that corresponds to a description object.
- **CMFormatDescription.MediaType**: A type that describes format description media.
- **CMFormatDescription.MediaSubType**: A type that describes format description media subtypes.
- **CMFormatDescription.TimeCode**: A type that describes format description time codes.
- **CMFormatDescription.EqualityMask**: A type that describes format description equality masks.
- **CMFormatDescription.Extensions**: A type that describes format description extensions.
- **CMFormatDescription.ParameterSetCollection**: Collection of parameter sets in a video format description.

## Initializers

- **init(referencing:)**

## Type Aliases

- **CMFormatDescription.T**

## Format Description Types

- **CMAudioFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with audio format descriptions.
- **CMClosedCaptionFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with closed caption format descriptions.
- **CMMetadataFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with metadata format descriptions.
- **CMMuxedFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with muxed format descriptions.
- **CMTextFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with text format descriptions.
- **CMTimeCodeFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with time code format descriptions.
- **CMVideoFormatDescription**: A type you use to interact with video format descriptions.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
